interestingcomments.content: Did a stitching test to get megapixel over the weekend. I used three handheld vertical shots of 40 sunmicron-c stopped down (f8) and stitched to create a picture of 28mm FOV (landscape orientation) which has 48megapixel !! Worked brilliantly for landscapes. For buildings with straight lines, stitching was hit and miss but manually correctable. I don't need high megapixel cam for occasional use. M240 works brilliantly. --img--  Edited February 22, 2017 by jmahto
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: did a stitching test to get megapixel over the weekend. i used three handheld vertical shots of 40 sunmicron-c stopped down (f8) and stitched to create a picture of 28mm fov (landscape -----> orientation !!! ) which has 48megapixel !! worked brilliantly for landscapes. for buildings with straight lines, stitching was hit and miss but manually correctable. i don't need high megapixel cam for occasional use. m240 works brilliantly. --img--  edited february 22, 2017 by jmahto

interestingcomments.content: Thank you for the wealth of information. Interesting to see too, that the retaining ring in front of the front element maintains an identical serial number as the lens info ring, Seems like that was a carry-over from the older lenses. AHA !!! THANKS A LOT, Chubkins ! I hadn't noticed that "gray" detail in the Leicashop item !! --img--  So, after all, it is NOT identical to my standard item, which, as normal, has the s/n only on the front ring ! the s/n on the retaining ring is typical/unique of the A36 (with opposite orientation in the older items, like my 750.361)... and you can find A36 items even in the 1.3xx.xxx range (white painted, but exactly with that style) . So... ok, it has a very distinguishing/rare feature...I could even consider to buy it... --img-- ... it is clearly a lens cell made for the A36 fitted on the new M3 Mount... Edited December 6, 2017 by luigi bertolotti
